text: The 2012-13 Red Bull Salzburg season brought the biggest embarrassment in the club's history. In the Champions League they failed to qualify against the Luxembourg amateur club FC Dudelange. They also only finished second in the championship. In the cup they were eliminated in the semi-finals against the regional league club FC Pasching. ==Squad== 2012/13 * Goalkeepers: 1 Eddie Gustafsson (5/0), 33 Alexander Walke (30/0) ,20 Thomas Dähne (1/0) * Defenders: 5 Christopher Dibon (3/0), 6 Christian Schwegler (17/0), 8 Florian Klein (20/0), 15 Franz Schiemer (27/4), 17 Andreas Ulmer (26/0), 23 Ibrahim Sekagya (16/1), 29 Rodnei (14/0), 36 Martin Hinteregger (23/2), 45 Isaac Vorsah (15/1) * Midfielders: 13 Stefan Ilsanker (17/0), 14 Valon Berisha (30/6), 18 Dušan Švento (11/1), 22 Stefan Hierländer (20/1), 24 Christoph Leitgeb (22/4), 35 Stefan Savic (0/0), 37 Valentino Lazaro (2/0), 39 Georg Teigl (13/0), 40 Sadio Mané (26/16), 44 Kevin Kampl (23/4) * Forwards: 16 Havard Nielsen (12/3), 26 Jonatan Soriano (33/26), 27 Alan (14/11), 31 Bright Edomwonyi (0/0) * Coaching staff: Roger Schmidt (Head coach), Oliver Glasner (Assistance coach), Herbert Ilsanker (Goalkeeper coach) FC Salzburg Wiki ==Matches== Austria Soccer ==Table== Rang Team M W D L Goals Points 1 FK Austria Wien 36 25 7 4 84:31 82 2 FC Red Bull Salzburg 36 22 11 3 91:39 77 3 SK Rapid Wien 36 16 9 12 57:39 57 4 SK Sturm Graz 36 13 9 14 49:56 48 5 Wolfsberger AC 36 12 11 13 53:56 47 6 SV Ried 36 13 7 16 60:59 46 7 SC Wiener Neustadt 36 9 9 18 32:60 36 8 FC Wacker Innsbruck 36 11 3 22 41:75 36 9 FC Admira Wacker Mödling 36 9 8 19 47:68 35 10 SV Mattersburg 36 9 8 19 36:67 35 FC Salzburg Wiki ==Austrian Cup== ==Champions League qualification== ==Friendly matches== Austria Soccer ==Topscorer== Goals Name 1 26 Jonatan Soriano 2 16 Sadio Mane 3 11 Alan ==References== Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg seasons Category:2012 in association football Category:2013 in association football
